intro: Steetzia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, including Steetzia argyrophylla and Steetzia macrophylla. The plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. They typically grow in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. Steetzia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
